newsitem.title: CAMBODIA: Cambodian inflation rises 6.6 percent in May.
newsitem.headline: Cambodian inflation rises 6.6 percent in May.

text.p: Cambodian inflation rose by 6.6 percent year-on-year in May compared with 6.3 percent in April, the central bank said in a monthly report released on Thursday.
The May consumer price index stood at 114.89 versus 114.12 in April, the Cambodian National Bank said.
The 12-month moving average inflation rate was 7 percent in May, down from 7.2 percent in April, the bank said.
Inflation stood at 7.1 percent for the whole of 1996.

The bank also said the Cambodian riel depreciated 5 percent against the U.S. dollar in the 12-month period up to May and was now trading at 2,755 riel to the dollar, compared with 2,748 riel to the dollar in April.
